sources.title: Latest imported feed items on ArmchairCelts

articles.description:
Photo by Ian MacNicol/Getty Images
  

 The main news from Celtic Park today was the unsurprising exit of Boli Bolingoli, the man who caused grown men to put his surname on their twitter display names back in 2019. 


      I Boli Bolingoli tekende voor twee seizoenen en komt de linkerflank van KVM versterken ❤️Meer info  https://t.co/GtKClzCuaH#trotsoponzekleuren #Boliisnekakker— KV Mechelen (@kvmechelen) July 12, 2022



The left back joined KV Mechelen earlier today in a permanent deal. 
The writing has indeed been on the wall for the much maligned Belgian, who incurred the wrath of Neil Lennon, the entire support and of course the wonderful Scottish Government in August 2020 after THAT flight to Spain. 


Celtic boss Neil Lennon says there’s been no explaination from Boli Bolingoli about why he flew to Spain for an overnight. “I’m absolutely livid, it’s a total betrayal of trust” pic.twitter.com/eLZivwB35w— Clyde 1 Superscoreboard (@ClydeSSB) August 11, 2020



Nicola Sturgeon even gave Scottish Football the dreaded yellow card!


  Nicola Sturgeon hands Scottish football a yellow card  and warns next time it will be a red  #Bolingoli #nicolasturgeon  pic.twitter.com/DUhDPpTYpu— The Daily Record (@Daily_Record) August 11, 2020



He infamously made an appearance in the brutal 1-0 loss at the Anthony Macaroni last season too! 


Guess who is back for Celtic Boli Bolingoli has been handed a surprise start by Ange Postecoglou, can he take the chance against Livingston? ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/u6Ae876Qjc pic.twitter.com/X1VfmtO1Gb— Daily Record Sport (@Record_Sport) September 19, 2021



Then weighed in with an assist for David Turnbull’s screamer against Motherwell at Fir Park. 
Here’s the goals from that game:


David Turnbull struck a glorious goal on his first appearance back at Fir Park for Celtic as the visitors beat Motherwell 2-0  pic.twitter.com/34JzlKKx99— Sky Sports Scotland (@ScotlandSky) October 16, 2021



He came, he worked a lot of people into a shoot and he left.
Boli Bolingoli, thank you for your service and all the best, I suppose.
TOMORROW: Banik Ostrava V Celtic - ‘reaction’ of sorts.
articles.title: Boli Bolingoli away

articles.description:
Ben Foster and former England goalkeeping coach Dave Watson have been waxing lyrical about Celtic goalkeeper Joe Hart on Foster’s latest podcast. The pod, appropriately named ‘The Fozcast’ spoke about Joe Hart playing for England and what he brought to the table both on and off the field. The pair discussed how it would’ve been […]
Source
articles.title: Video: Ben Foster’s ‘Incredible’ Praise for Celtic Leader Joe Hart

articles.description: Celtic have been told that they will need to pay £5.5m if they are to sign Fausto Vera. The defensive midfielder has emerged as a target following Vinicius Souza’s move to Espanyol. The 22-year-old has 18 months remaining on his deal with Argentinos Juniors, who have set their price amidst interest in their player. According Read More
articles.title: Celtic will need to pay £5.5m to land reported midfield target

articles.description:
Matt O’Riley was asked whether he expects Rangers to ‘come back strong’ on Celtic this coming season but expertly handled it, just as his teammates have before this summer. Outlets will always chance their arm with a question about the title race. It’s undeniably a talking point for neutrals or those looking for stories heading ...
The post Another Celtic star expertly bats away media's Rangers question; squad well drilled appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Another Celtic star expertly bats away media's Rangers question; squad well drilled

articles.description: Lewis Ferguson and Josh Doig have sealed moves from the SPFL to Italy’s Serie A today. The Scottish duo had been linked with Celtic prior to Ange Postecoglou taking over in the summer of 2021 and now they have sealed moves, albeit not to The Scottish Champions but to Italian outfits Bologna and Hella Verona. Read More
articles.title: Pair of Premiership talents, previously linked with Celtic, complete Serie A moves

articles.description: However well-meaning Peter Grant might be tonight, in calling for the scrapping of the League Cup he is dead wrong to do so and Celtic should have no part in it. I don’t think Ange or anyone connected to the football operation would welcome such a move. In putting this forward tonight, Grant has given […]
articles.title: Calls To Axe The League Cup Should Not Be Entertained By Anyone At Celtic Park.

articles.description: Celtic right-back Josip Juranovic could leave this summer if Ange Postecoglou captures his latest target, according to ex-Hoops striker Frank McAvennie. The Lowdown: Full-backs on the move? The Hoops are about to embark on a hugely exciting 2022/23 season, not only starting it as Scottish Premiership champions but also returning to the Champions League. While […]
articles.title: 'A third player...' - McAvennie reacts to Celtic interest in another defensive signing

articles.description:
Former Hoops hero Peter Grant has put out a passionate plea to the Scottish football governing bodies to scrap the league cup. Grant insists the cup competition is not beneficial to most of the clubs who participate and Scottish football at club and international level would benefit from its removal. Grant told SunSport: “One thing […]
Source
articles.title: ‘Is it worth it?’ Major Scottish Football Debate Reopened

articles.description:
Negotiations are underway behind the scenes on a Celtic tour to Japan in 2023, Japanese outlet Sponichi has reported this week. Ever since Ange Postecoglou arrived at Celtic, along with Kyogo Furuhashi, there’s been chatter amongst supporters that the Bhoys might be tempted to return to the country, having previously visited for a match in ...
The post Report: Celtic enter exciting negotiations on initiative Ange has been 'pushing for' appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Report: Celtic enter exciting negotiations on initiative Ange has been 'pushing for'

articles.description:
As the Celtic squad departs Austria for the next pre-season phase, it’s worth reflecting on the last week and what we’ve seen from the training camp. Thankfully, we’ve been able to see quite a lot. In fact, it feels like the Celtic in-house media crew have really upped their game this summer in an attempt ...
The post Celtic step up their media game appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Celtic step up their media game

articles.description: Barkas was first to go. Bolingoli has followed him. Of the three names the hacks constantly try to taunt us with, two have departed and only one remains. The guy who’s left has played more games than the others, and is taking a full part in the pre-season. But Albian Ajeti will very soon be […]
articles.title: Two Of Celtic’s “Failed Three” Are Already Gone. Ajeti Remains For Now.

articles.description:
Although much of the excitement around Celtic’s transfer window has focused on incoming players, it was always just as important to move on the high-earning fringe players who have no future under Ange Postecoglou. We’ve seen the club move as quickly as possible to make this happen. Vasilis Barkas left on loan FC Utrecht weeks ...
The post The next candidate for Celtic exit after pleasing Tuesday announcement appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: The next candidate for Celtic exit after pleasing Tuesday announcement

articles.description: Tonight Celtic have managed to clear the decks further ahead of the new season kicking off, as perpetual misfit Boli Bolingoli has joined KV Mechelen. The Belgian side who also took Marian Shved off of our hands will now add another Hoops disaster signing amongst their contingent. Boli arrived at Celtic Park during Neil Lennon’s Read More
articles.title: Celtic Clearout Continues – Boli Bolingoli joins KV Mechelen

articles.description:
Callum McGregor isn’t shying away from a challenge this season and is hoping Celtic pull one of the most difficult teams out of the hat in August’s Champions League draw. Real Madrid won last season’s tournament and will be among the front runners for the 2022/23 edition too. Naturally, they are pot one seeds and ...

articles.title: Celtic star names team's preferred Champions League draw

articles.description:
CALLUM MCGREGOR isn’t showing away from the big guns in the Champions League, declaring he and many of the squad would like to draw Spanish giants Real Madrid. The midfielder will lead Celtic out into the hot cauldron of the Champions league as captain this season and when it comes to challenges, Callum wants a […]

articles.title: Callum McGregor Makes Bold Champions League Statement

articles.description:
Callum McGregor has been talking up the work of the Celtic squad in Austria as they prepare to move on to Czechia and ultimately back to Scotland. McGregor has had a busy summer on Scotland duty, only really getting the benefit of a few weeks off between seasons. Nonetheless, he’s relishing getting stuck into Ange ...

articles.title: Celtic hero feeling benefits of gruelling double sessions at Austrian training camp

articles.description:
Celtic have been clearing the deck for the next stage of Ange Postecoglou’s Parkhead tenure. We now count TWELVE players who have move out of the club this summer with only three loans among them. It was always going to be the case there would be more outgoings than incomings after the upheaval the summer […]
Source
articles.title: Celtic’s Summer Exit Tally Reaches 12

articles.description: BLUNDER Bhoy Boli Bolingoli has left Celtic on a permanent deal to return to Belgium with Mechelen. The frozen-out left-back, who made only two first-team appearances for Ange Postecoglou, has gone after playing only 31 games since his £3million arrival from Austrian outfit Rapid Vienna in the summer of 2019, according to a report on [...]
articles.title: BYE BYE BLUNDER BHOY BOLI

articles.description: Celtic have held internal talks over Argentinos Juniors midfielder Fausto Vera and updates could be imminent in the ‘coming days’, according to journalist Fraser Fletcher. The Lowdown: Vera impresses in homeland The 22-year-old has matured into a key player for his current side, impressing in a defensive midfield role and winning eight caps for Argentina’s […]
articles.title: 'Coming days...' - Celtic hold internal discussions over another South American signing

articles.description:
Boli Bolingoli has signed for Belgian top-flight side KV Mechelen on a two-year contract, ending his spell at Celtic for good. Bolingoli was signed by Neil Lennon in 2019 but was rarely convincing and ultimately fell foul of the club’s Covid-19 restrictions in 2020. He never really recovered from that hidden trip to Spain after ...
The post Boli Bolingoli speaks after permanent Celtic exit; Mechelen explain signing to fans appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Boli Bolingoli speaks after permanent Celtic exit; Mechelen explain signing to fans

articles.description:
Boli Bolingoli has finally left Celtic on a permanent basis. The club announced on Tuesday afternoon the defender has moved to Belgian side Mechelen. Boli was signed under Neil Lennon and had an ok first season. The following campaign would be a disaster for Boli and Celtic. The pandemic hit and football as we know […]
Source
articles.title: Confirmed: Boli Bolingoli Permanent Celtic Exit

articles.description:
We all know about the transfer work being done by Celtic this summer. Cameron Carter-Vickers, Jota, Alexandro Bernabei and Ben Siegrist have all signed up, bringing a total spend beyond £15m. Work continues behind the scenes with a belief that the club are looking to bring in a midfielder and a defender at least, with ...

articles.title: Scottish Premiership rivals ramp up transfer work as Celtic prepare to defend title

articles.description: Since the story about our “interest” in Fausto Vera broke, I have been waiting on two things; a confirmed bid from Celtic, or someone at Celtic confirming that we were ready to make one. None of these things has happened. The Vera story remains something that our media got from somewhere else, and ran as […]
articles.title: In Spite Of The Headlines, Celtic Never Confirmed Any Interest In Fausto Vera.

articles.description:
FAUSTO VERA has been linked with a move to Celtic for the past couple of weeks. The Argentine Defensive midfielder looks destined to leave this current club Argentines Junior. Reports in recent days claim Fausto has been on a list of potential signings at Celtic Park but no contact has been made between the two […]
Source
articles.title: Report: Celtic Target Subject to €6m Bid Elsewehere

articles.description:
Banik Ostrava manager Pavel Vrba says the upcoming clash against Celtic will be the highlight of their summer preparations for the new season. Vrba has a long association with Banik but only returned to the club for his latest spell as manager this year after leaving Sparta Prague. The former national team manager is well ...

articles.title: Czech boss says Celtic match will be his highlight of the summer

articles.description:
If you think tomorrow night’s Celtic friendly away to Banik Ostrava will be a run-of-the-mill pre-season affair, think again. It’s shaping up to be quite the event as the club celebrate their 100th anniversary. The Czech club expect a big crowd at their 15,000-capacity stadium, with the ultras section sold out for over a month ...

articles.description: When Rabbi Matondo signed for Schalke he cost them £11 million. This is the big headline number which some in the media has been promoting since Ibrox’s interest in him was made official. “Ibrox linked with £11 million winger” and all that. But Matondo is not an £11 million player anymore. Although he was. He’s […]
articles.title: Sevconomics And The Reality Of Signing An “£11 Million Player” For £2 Million.

After Saturday evening’s 3-3 draw with Rapid Vienna, Ange Postecoglou will hope that his team will continue to get minutes under their belt as they get set up for a return to Paradise. English Championship side Blackburn Rovers arrive as the opposition on Saturday and Read More

This week, many of them are scratching their heads at his latest bizarre theory. The rest are just laughing at him. As he said the other night on the radio, expanding on […]
articles.title: Hugh Keevins Barmy “Fivers And Tenners” Nonsense Has Celtic Fans Laughing At Him.

articles.description: Aaron Hickey’s incredible £19m move to Brentford looks like an eye-opener for Italian football.  Bologna paid around 10% of that for the Scotland international two years earlier.  Now Hibs have accepted a £3m bid from Hellas Verona for Josh Doig, while Aberdeen have accepted a bid for the same money for Lewis Ferguson.  Scottish players of [...]

articles.description: THERE are certain misconceptions that people may have about Cameron Carter-Vickers by virtue of his imposing physical stature. He isn’t called ‘The Fridge’ because he is cool under pressure, though that is one of the attributes that has made him such a good fit for Ange Postecoglou’s Celtic.
articles.title: Cameron Carter-Vickers thanks parents and Tottenham mentor as gentle giant expresses gratitude for Celtic opportunity

articles.description: FORMER Celtic midfielder Peter Grant reckons that one of Scotland's three  domestic cup competitions should be scrapped - as the congested fixture list is having an adverse effect on lower league clubs and the national team.
articles.title: Former Celtic midfielder Peter Grant calls for domestic cup competition to be axed

articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR says that Celtic are hoping to pull Real Madrid out of the hat in the Champions League, with the club captain aiming for personal redemption against Luka Modric.
articles.title: Celtic skipper Callum McGregor targets Luka Modric revenge mission in Champions League

articles.title: Celtic outcast Boli Bolingoli seals KV Mechelen move

articles.description: CELTIC are reportedly planning a pre-season trip to Japan next summer.
articles.title: Celtic 'planning' Japan 2023 pre-season tour

articles.description: MATT O’RILEY says that Celtic expect their rivals to come back at them stronger next season, but that will be irrelevant if Ange Postecoglou’s team play to their potential.
articles.title: Matt O’Riley expects rivals to roar back, but thinks Celtic will have too much for the competition

articles.description: THE movement of Kyogo has left many a defender dizzy since he burst onto the scene at Celtic last season, but his speed is such that it is often difficult even for his own teammates to keep up with him.
articles.title: Kyogo is even a step ahead of Celtic teammates says David Turnbull, as he relishes link-up with striker next season

articles.description: WITH the greatest of respect to MK Dons, the rise of their former captain Matt O’Riley has been a remarkable one over the past six months or so. Not only has the young midfielder become an integral member of the Celtic squad, but he may well find himself at the World Cup come the end of the year.
articles.title: Matt O’Riley aiming to cap off Celtic rise with World Cup place – with a little help from Morten Wieghorst

articles.description: SCOTT BAIN is set to remain at Celtic this season due to Champions League ruling.
articles.title: Scott Bain's Celtic summer transfer conundrum as Champions League ruling set to make his decision

articles.description: TOM ROGIC has been pictured in Sydney with uncertainty surrounding his future.
articles.title: Tom Rogic transfer latest as Celtic hero pictured following Australia boss Graham Arnold's 'concerns'

articles.description: CELTIC will reportedly hold contract talks with St Mirren youngster Dylan Reid today.
articles.title: Dylan Reid to Celtic latest as Ange Postecoglou to sell move to St Mirren youngster

articles.description: JAMES FORREST is a player who, it would be fair to say, has sometimes split opinion among the Celtic fanbase during his long career at the club. For a winger, it comes with the territory.
articles.title: James Forrest not content with making up the numbers at Celtic as winger looks to become main player for Ange Postecoglou

articles.description: KYOGO has set himself a minimum target of 20 goals next season as he looks to wrest the title of Scotland’s top scorer away from teammate Giorgos Giakoumakis.
articles.title: Kyogo sets goal target as he vows to oust Celtic teammate from top of scoring charts

articles.description: CELTIC’s wait for the glamour of top-level European competition has been a long one, with the fans deprived of those famous group stage matches at Celtic Park for five years. Their wait will soon be over, as will Joe Hart’s, who has gone even longer without tasting the business end of the Champions League.
articles.title: Joe Hart says Celtic will take on Europe’s best on their own terms with Champions League wait almost over

articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU has confirmed that Celtic are interested in bringing St Mirren youngster Dylan Reid to the club for their B team, but that his focus is firmly on strengthening his first-team as he continues to work on a ‘couple’ of targets.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou focused on first-team recruits as Celtic make move for youngster Dylan Reid

articles.description: Ismaila Soro has departed Celtic on loan after linking up with Portuguese outfit FC Arouca.
articles.title: Celtic's Ismaila Soro joins FC Arouca on loan as midfielder departs Parkhead
